Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand the normative process described and then compare each case in the event log against it to find any violations Let me start by summarizing the key points from the normative description The process starts with Receive order Then the next step must be Check inventory After that depending on the inventory result the path diverges If inventory is sufficient The sequence should continue with Authorize payment then Package items followed by Ship order and finally Close order So the order here is strict Check Authorize Package Ship Close Also Authorize payment must come after Check and before Package Similarly Ship must be after Package and before Close If inventory is insufficient After Check inventory the next step is Cancel order then Close order So the path is Check Cancel Close Importantly after cancellation you cant do any fulfillment steps like Package or Ship Also Close must be the last step in all cases Key constraints mentioned Authorize payment must be after Check and before Package Package items must be after Authorize and before Ship Ship order must be after Package and cannot happen after Cancel Close order is always the final step

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with Case 1 Activities in order 1 Receive 2 Check inventory 3 Authorize payment 4 Package items 5 Ship order 6 Close order This seems to follow the sufficient inventory path Check comes after Receive then Authorize after Check Package after Authorize Ship after Package and Close last No violations here So Case 1 is okay

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 2 Activities 1 Receive 2 Check inventory 3 Package items 4 Authorize payment 5 Ship order 6 Close order Wait here after Check inventory the next activity is Package items But according to the norm after Check if inventory is sufficient you should do Authorize payment next But here they went straight to Package without Authorize Thats a problem The norm says Authorize must come after Check and before Package So Package cant happen before Authorize So this is a violation Also after Authorize they did Ship but in the correct sequence after Authorize should be Package then Ship Here Authorize is after Package which is wrong

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Activities 1 Receive 2 Check inventory 3 Authorize payment 4 Cancel order 5 Ship order 6 Close order Hmm after Check inventory they did Authorize payment But if the inventory was insufficient then after Check they should go to Cancel But here they did Authorize before Cancel Wait but how do we know if the inventory was sufficient or not The problem says the normative process branches based on inventory check However the event log doesnt specify the outcome of the Check inventory step The norm says that if inventory is sufficient proceed with the payment steps if not go to Cancel But in the event log we dont have explicit information on whether the inventory was sufficient So this is an ambiguity The description says that the process must branch into cancellation if inventory is insufficient So if after Check inventory the next step is Cancel that implies insufficient But in Case 3 after Check they went to Authorize payment That suggests that the inventory was sufficient However then they later Cancel the order But according to the norm once you proceed down the sufficient path Authorize you shouldnt cancel

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Activities 1 Receive 2 Check inventory 3 Cancel order 4 Close order This looks like the insufficient inventory path Check Cancel Close Thats exactly what the norm says for insufficient inventory So this is correct No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Activities 1 Receive 2 Check inventory 3 Authorize payment 4 Ship order 5 Close order Wait after Check inventory they went to Authorize then Ship But according to the norm after Authorize should come Package then Ship Here they skipped Package and went straight from Authorize to Ship So Package items is missing between Authorize and Ship Thats a violation because the norm requires Package after Authorize and before Ship So Case 5 is violating because they didnt package before shipping

Name: Validation - IND
Text: So summarizing the violations Case 2 Package items before Authorize payment violates the order must Authorize before Package Ship order before Package items since Ship must come after Package Also the overall sequence after Check is Package Authorize Ship which is completely out of order Case 3 After Check inventory they proceeded to Authorize payment implying sufficient inventory but then later did Cancel order Since Cancel is only for insufficient inventory this is a problem The norm requires that if inventory is sufficient you dont cancel Alternatively if the Cancel was due to another reason not covered by the norm but the norm doesnt mention that so its a violation Ship order after Cancel order which is prohibited because after Cancel you should only go to Close Case 5 Ship order before Package items The norm requires Package after Authorize and before Ship So missing Package step between Authorize and Ship Case 1 and 4 are okay

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait let me reexamine Case 3 again The problem is whether the inventory was sufficient or not The event log doesnt tell us the result of Check inventory The norm says that the process branches based on the inventory result but since we dont have that info how do we interpret it The norm says if the inventory check reveals that there is not enough stock but in the event log after Check the next step is Authorize So if the inventory was sufficient then proceeding to Authorize is correct But then they later do Cancel The norm doesnt allow cancellation once youve passed the inventory check and proceeded to payment steps So the Cancel here is unexpected The norms description doesnt mention any possibility of cancellation after Authorize So this is a violation because the process went into cancellation after starting the fulfillment path Alternatively maybe the Cancel could be a separate decision but according to the given normative process the only time you cancel is immediately after Check if inventory is low So any Cancel after that is not part of the norm Therefore Case 3s Cancel is a violation because it comes after Authorize Also the Ship after Cancel is another violation So the violations are as I listed Now let me structure this properly
